title: Business & Finance
text:
A consortium of private-equity firms that includes Elliott is in advanced talks to buy TV-ratings company Nielsen for about $15 billion including debt.

---

Tencent is facing a potential record fine for violations of some Chinese central bank regulations by its WeChat Pay mobile network.

---

A surge in Covid-19 cases has led Chinese manufacturing hubs Shenzhen and Changchun to lock down, halting production at many electronics and auto plants.

---

The Nasdaq and S&P 500 fell 2% and 0.7%, respectively, while the Dow edged up 1.05 points. Brent crude futures fell 5.1%.

---

The London Metal Exchange said buying and selling of nickel will resume on Wednesday, after suspending the market for six trading sessions.

---

Foxconn is in talks with Saudi Arabia about jointly building a $9 billion multipurpose facility in that country.

---

German prosecutors said they charged Wirecard ex-CEO Braun with suspected market manipulation and false representation of the company's financial accounts.

---

Former Disney CEO Iger has invested in metaverse startup Genies and joined the company's board.
